meanings.definition: Exposure to or possibility of danger or harm
meanings.sent1: Playing near the edge of the cliff puts you in jeopardies.
meanings.sent2: The explorers faced jeopardies while crossing the treacherous terrain.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity led it into jeopardies when it climbed the tall tree.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs can lead to jeopardies as dark as a stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge's creaking hinted at the jeopardies lurking below.

meanings.sent1: Not wearing a helmet while biking is a jeopardies to your safety.
meanings.sent2: Investing in that volatile stock carries financial jeopardies.
meanings.sent3: Eating spicy food before a long car ride can lead to digestive jeopardies.
meanings.sent4: The shaky ladder posed jeopardies to anyone attempting to climb it.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds signaled the jeopardies of an approaching storm.

meanings.sent1: The superhero bravely faced the jeopardies posed by the villain.
meanings.sent2: The warning signs indicated the jeopardies of swimming in the rough sea.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel didn't realize the jeopardies of stealing from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The looming shadow cast by the mountain hinted at the jeopardies of the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map revealed the jeopardies awaiting those who dared to venture into the forbidden forest.
